Name: Text
Description: Retrieve stored texts by HTTP GET request. Save texts to the system using HTTP POST request. Texts may contain HTML markup, it will be preserved in translation and the markup will be excluded from word count.

Parameters.desc: text_id is a unique key for your content. It must be an alphanumeric string, maximum length is 64 characters. If group_id is provided, it will be prefixed with the group id, i.e. each group has namespace of its own for text ids.

group_id is a unique group name for your text keys. It is recommended to use your project or app name to avoid text id collisions between projects. If provided, it must be an alphanumeric string and it has maximum length of 32 characters.
language is the language code (e.g. en-gb) which the text is written in. Please see Languages for more details.
Text: either source text to translate or previously made translation you want to save into our system. May contain HTML. Please use UTF-8.

invalidate_translations is a boolean value (1/0 or on/off) which controls if translations are trashed or not. E.g. if you make a spelling error correction to the original text, you probably do not want to trash the translations and re-translate the text. Also if you save previously made translation to our system using this method, it is important to set invalidate_translations off!
Authentication token. Please see Authenticate for more details.

POST-only. Array of text keys and content. Either JSON array (string; e.g. {"foo": "Foooooooooooooooo", "bar": "Bar"}) or a POST parameter array (e.g. texts[foo]=Foooooooo&texts[bar]=Bar).

invalidate_translations is a boolean value (1/0 or on/off) which controls if translations are trashed or not. E.g. if you make a spelling error correction to the original text, you probably do not want to trash the translations and re-translate the text. Also if you save previously made translation to our system using this method, it is important to set invalidate_translations off! Warning! Affects ALL texts set on the same request. If you need to invalidate some and keep others, you have to perform two requests.

Name: TextsTranslate
Description: You can order translations for new and changed texts by calling this method.

Parameters.desc: group_id is a unique group name for your text keys. It is recommended to use your project or app name to avoid text id collisions between projects. If provided, it must be an alphanumeric string and it has maximum length of 32 characters.
language is the language code (e.g. en-gb) which the text is written in. Please see Languages for more details.

Target languages to translate texts into. Provide language codes as a JSON-array (e.g. ["fi", "fr-fr"]) or use post fields (target_languages[]=1&target_languages[]=4&target_languages[]=11 or target_languages[]=fi&target_languages[]=fr-fr). Please see Languages for more details.
Texts to translate. Provide array as string (JSON: [{"id":"my_text_id"},{"id":"some_another_key"}]) or post fields (texts[][id]=my_text_id&texts[][id]=some_another_key)
Context information and other relevant information to the translator such as tone (formal/informal).
Callback URL which will be called once translation is completed. Please see Callbacks for more details.
To avoid surprisingly costly orders, you can specify maximum word count to order. If limit is exceeded, the order will fail.

Translator level: economy or business. Default is business [translator]. Valid values are:
  • economy
  • business
deliver_by_email is a boolean value which controls if the completed translation is delivered by email to customer's email address.
If deliver_by_email is on, deliver to this email address instead of customer's email address.
Title for the project to identify it on delivery.
Authentication token. Please see Authenticate for more details.
